data.title: Nameless Places by Gerald Page Editor
data.meta_description: Nameless Places by Page, Gerald W. (editor) and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good+. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good+. First Edition. (w/dj)A clean tightly bound hardcover copy. Unmarked, gently read, showing gentle head and foot wear to the spine and edges of the dust jacket and lightly bumped corners. A really nice copy overall. Read descriptions carefully. Avoid GLASSFROGBOOKS, ERGODOBOOKS, MORE BOOKS, IRISH BOOKSELLERS, PRO QUO/BAYSIDE BOOKS, BOOKSPLEASE, RIA CHRISTIE, DISCOVER BOOKS, BOOKS2ANYWHERE, BOOKS EXPRESS, CHIRON MEDIA! These "Booksellers" have no books of their own. they buy honest booksellers' books, upcharge you and have no idea what the book is really like. Support your local and small bookstore owners!.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First edition , first printing ,1975 , WI. A fine book in the original binding. Clean with contents excellent. In a near fine dust jacket with slight rubbing at an edge and at the spine edge.

Octavo, cloth. First edition. 4160 copies printed. Original anthology collecting twenty-seven stories, some utilizing the Cthulhu mythos, by Thomas Burnett Swann, Robert Aickman, Brian Lumley, Ramsey Campbell, David Drake, and others. Tymn (ed), Horror Literature 4-288. A fine copy in fine dust jacket priced $7.50 on the front flap with just a touch of rubbing at the upper spine end. (#174086).

Hardcover. Condition: As New. Tim Kirk (illustrator). First edition. First edition, with Colophon. 1 of 4000. Black cloth, gilt lettering. 279 pp. Twenty-three stories of the macabre by twenty-three authors. Edited by Gerald W. Page.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. First Edition. Anthology of first-published macabre stories by 23 writers, including Lin Carter, Carl Jacobi, Ramsey Campbell, Brian Lumley and Denys Val Baker, edited and with an Introduction by Page. Fine in fine dustjacket.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. Tim Kirk (illustrator). 1st Edition. Arkham House, 1975. Hardcover. CONDITION: Fine, 1st edition. DJ CONDITION: Near Fine. Black cloth boards in like new condition, glossy with no surface, edge or corner wear. Spine straight, binding tight, gilt title text bright and shiny, no end wear. 279 pristine pages, bright, clean and unmarked. DJ in VG-NF condition; front panel slightly faded, no corner or edge wear save for very minor color chipping at top front corner and at bottom spine hinges. Protected in mylar. 27 weird tales by horror fiction's best.
